_header: Listen lordings what I shall say
Subjects: Katherine of Alexandria, saint; carols, of saints
_description: A song in honour of St. Katherine — five quatrains (aaab) with ‘Salue Caterina’ refrain and burden: A a a a / Salue Caterri[n]a

CamStJohn259.First Lines:
Lystyn lordygnys [sic] qwatte I xall seyA grette maruell
                    tell I may…
CamStJohn259.Note:
5 x 4, aaab, including refrain, ‘Salue caterina’, plus
                    burden, ‘A A A A salue caterina’ followed by false start to 6282
CamStJohn259.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes,  and  G. C. Macaulay, eds.  
             “Fifteenth Century Carols and Other Pieces.” 
             Modern Language Review
         8 (1913): 68-87: 71-2.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 215-6; 1977, 191.
